intro: Cichlanthus lepidotus, commonly known as the velvetleaf cichloris, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are thick and velvety, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded areas under the canopy of forests.
